revised_title: Reproduction and Development of Ascaris mystax
tldr: The author investigates the reproduction and development of Ascaris mystax, a parasitic worm found in the intestinal canal of domestic cats. The article describes the anatomy and reproductive organs of both male and female Ascaris mystax, as well as the process of sperm development and the transformation of the semen within the male and female organisms. This study provides valuable insights into the life cycle and reproduction of parasitic worms.
